item.title: Help with Spam
item.dc:creator: @demon_fox337 demon fox337
item.description:
@demon_fox337 wrote:

matt r 91:

&& playerRights > 1

would mean player rights have to be above 1 to use the command common player playerRights = 0 and i trust all my mods with the highest level of confidence, also the ip mute works i tested it but just not in this case altho i think i have found a solution to this could someone post so i can post again (cant double post)(gonna post the “possible” solution

Read full topic

item.title: Help with Spam
item.dc:creator: @matt_r_91 matt r 91
item.description:
@matt_r_91 wrote:

On the players name if they use the multi account span it would go like

Playername
Playername1
Playername2
And so on ip the one without the number at the end and I’m sure ipmute is for staff so change
&& playerRights > 1 or w.e

Read full topic

item.title: Help with Spam
item.dc:creator: @demon_fox337 demon fox337
item.description:
@demon_fox337 wrote:

Every once in a while i get a noob who decides to somehow make 15x of the same account and spamm the crap out of my server and when i try to ip mute or ip ban them it says player name does not exist what can i do about this? Heres my ipmute command

if (command.startsWith(“ipmute”) && playerRights > 0) {
try {
String otherPName = command.substring(7);
int otherPIndex = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(otherPName);

                if (otherPIndex != -1) {
                    client p = (client) server.playerHandler.players[otherPIndex];
                    writeLog(p.connectedFrom, "mutes2");
     p.muted = true;
                    p.sM(
                            "You have been ip muted by " + playerName);
     sM("You have ip muted "+p.playerName+"");
                } else { 
                   sM("The name doesnt exist."); 
                }
            } catch (Exception e) { 
                sM("Try entering a name you want to tele to ip mute..");
            }
        }

Read full topic
